We develop technical prowess for refugees from over ten countries

Across the spectrum, refugee communities have demonstrated a strong interest in technology and motivation to learn. However, limited access and opportunity, largely due to cost, location, transportation options and knowledge of resources often prevent full use of resources available.

Watch a video 2m 34s
· noun

a person who has been forced to leave their country in order to escape war, persecution, or natural disaster.

Working in  conjunction  with

Refugees face significant barriers to economic & educational success upon arrival.

  • Learning  English
  • Navigating a  new culture
  • Understanding  American systems
  • Technical  skills barriers

We empower refugees with our courses that set them up for success in the tech industry.

We develop students’ creative & problem-solving skills

Classes use of innovative multi-cultural learning materials & technologies like Virtual & Augmented Reality.

We connect students with real-life professionals

Students learn from, and work with skills-based corporate volunteers, who create an easy-to-learn visual curriculum.

We create tech-based stem opportunities

Our program builds pathways for students to enter into employment, entrepreneurship & college.
